TopicTitle: Win10 / KSP 1.1.3 - Unable to [Shift] Mouse Wheel

Articles.Content:
I am sure that this is something in Win10 and I just don't know about it.

I just upgraded to Win10, so far I am liking the OS, KSP runs, I can seem to play my game just fine.  [Modded or Unmodded] however;

When I am in the editor [vanilla or modded] , it would seem that the "Shift" key isn't being acknowledged and I am unable to zoom in or out with the mouse wheel in either the SPH or the VAB.

Try pressing down the mouse-wheel and dragging up or down. Also try using ALT instead of SHIFT.

(MMB+drag or ALT+scroll)

Thanks for the reply @DaMachinator

 

The ALT + Scroll is just like using the mouse wheel
Yes, I can MMB and drag and wow that is so slow.

When I first started to play KSP 1.0.4 , I have always been able to use the "SHIFT" key + Scroll , didn't loose the functionality until Win10.  So, I am thinking someone knows something?
I don't know, since I never knew the other method existed. I've always just used the MMB. You get used to it, after a while. Lots of picking up the mouse while holding MMB down.

Actually - I found the problem.

Since I am a streamer [or a wanna be one]  I use a program called Synergy and it would seem that there is now a conflict as I can stop the service and then the SHIFT works just fine.

Now, I just have to find how to fix it.

EDIT: as a work around, I can restart the Synergy service and this works until I reboot the gaming pc.
